<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 280, 171, 291]]<|/det|> # PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 393, 311]]<|/det|> Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 341, 415, 352]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 361, 368, 372]]<|/det|> No Additional Materials are required. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 394, 388, 405]]<|/det|> # READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 420, 718, 432]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 325, 446]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 449, 503, 461]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 504, 475]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 477, 380, 488]]<|/det|> DO **NOT** WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 503, 256, 514]]<|/det|> Answer **all** questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 359, 540]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 543, 767, 555]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 569, 605, 580]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 583, 758, 595]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 124, 87]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 102, 666, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass unit \(1u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81\mathrm{ms}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 167, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 108, 560, 145]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 525, 179]]<|/det|>
\[W = p\Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 194, 536, 223]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 235, 521, 252]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 264, 560, 295]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 305, 536, 321]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 340, 612, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_{0}^{2} - x^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 380, 536, 415]]<|/det|>
\[f_{0} = \frac{f_{s}V}{\nu \pm \nu_{s}}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 425, 536, 459]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 467, 625, 485]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 500, 595, 518]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 530, 525, 555]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 570, 530, 587]]<|/det|>
\[I = A n v q\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 604, 595, 621]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 637, 625, 654]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[434, 668, 518, 700]]<|/det|>
\[V_{H} = \frac{BI}{ntq}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 715, 558, 732]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 747, 578, 765]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 775, 536, 810]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 918, 352]]<|/det|>
A remote-controlled toy car moves up a ramp and travels across a gap to land on another ramp, as illustrated in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 363, 863, 515]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 1.1</center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 562, 918, 625]]<|/det|>
The car leaves ramp P with a velocity of \(5.5 \text{ms}^{-1}\) at an angle \(\theta\) to the horizontal. The horizontal component of the car's velocity as it leaves the ramp is \(4.6 \text{ms}^{-1}\). The car lands at the top of ramp Q. The tops of both ramps are at the same height and are distance \(d\) apart. Air resistance is negligible.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 640, 183, 658]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 640, 868, 657]]<|/det|>
Show that the car leaves ramp P with a vertical component of velocity of \(3.0 \text{ms}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 763, 920, 781]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 794, 180, 813]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[477, 917, 917, 934]]<|/det|>
<form>time taken = ............................................................... s [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 73, 180, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[527, 510, 918, 527]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 540, 144, 559]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 918, 574]]<|/det|>
Ramp Q is removed. The car again leaves ramp P as in **(b)** and now lands directly on the ground. The car leaves ramp P at time \(t = 0\) and lands on the ground at time \(t = T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 588, 918, 621]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 1.2, sketch the variation with time \(t\) of the vertical component \(\nu_{y}\) of the car's velocity from \(t = 0\) to \(t = T\). Numerical values of \(\nu_{y}\) and \(t\) are not required.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 479, 918, 513]]<|/det|>
The aircraft's engine produces a thrust force of \(2.0 \times 10^{3} \text{N}\) to move the aircraft through the air. The rate of increase in height of the aircraft is \(3.3 \text{m} \text{s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 527, 180, 545]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 570, 917, 603]]<|/det|>
The wavelength of the light is \(610\mathrm{nm}\). The distance between the double slit and the screen is \(2.7\mathrm{m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 617, 917, 681]]<|/det|>
An interference pattern of bright fringes and dark fringes is observed on the screen. The centres of the bright fringes are labelled B and centres of the dark fringes are labelled D. Point P is the centre of a particular dark fringe and point Q is the centre of a particular bright fringe, as shown in Fig. 4.1. The distance across five bright fringes is \(22\mathrm{mm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 695, 180, 713]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 695, 605, 712]]<|/det|>
The light waves leaving the two slits are coherent.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 726, 467, 742]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 760, 915, 775]]<|/det|>
......

<mark>[1]

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 722, 90]]<|/det|>
1. State the phase difference between the waves meeting at Q.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 103, 917, 120]]<|/det|>
<form>phase difference = ........................................................................... Â°</FORM>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 134, 744, 152]]<|/det|>
2. Calculate the path difference, in nm, of the waves meeting at P.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 257, 918, 275]]<|/det|>
<form>path difference = .................................................................... nm
